snippet: A man who fought in Vietnam and then delivered mail for decades should have been able to retire safely; he owned a house in Queens with a mortgage all but paid off. That latter fact, however, laid him low.
abstract: Michael Powell Gotham column on Stanley Theodore of Springfield Gardens, Queens, Vietnam veteran and retired postal worker fighting for his home after falling behind on mortgage payments; Theodore shares story of how Countrywide refused to cash three late checks while he waited for his pension to kick in, and then convinced him to sign over his mortgage, falsely promising him that his debt would be resolved before initiating foreclosure proceedings.
lead_paragraph: A man who fought in Vietnam and then delivered mail for decades should have been able to retire safely; he owned a house in Queens with a mortgage all but paid off. That latter fact, however, laid him low.

headline.main: Veteran Wages a New Fight: For His Home
